type: amended procurement contract for drones and cameras
short_summary: Purchase of unmanned aerial vehicles and several payloads
description: Establishment of a standing offer for the purchase of drones and cameras
tags: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
full_summary:
# F2402-220103 Drones and Cameras

## General Information

* **Reference Number**: WS3620527629-Doc3688225645
* **Amendment Number**: 3
* **Publication Date**: October 4, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: November 7, 2022, 2:00 PM MST

## Project Overview

Pêches et Océans Canada (DFO) has a requirement for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and several payloads. The Department is seeking a regional individual standing offer (OCIR) for the establishment of a Regional Individual Standing Offer (RFSO).

## Site Requirements

All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by November 7, 2022, at 2:00 PM MST. 

## Order Requirements and Dates

* **Expected Contract Start Date**: October 31, 2022
* **Expected Contract End Date**: No end date specified

## Eligibility and Commercial Agreement

There are no restrictions on bidder eligibility for this RFSO or for any other contract for which this standing offer may be used.

## Goods and Services Identification Number (GSTI)

* UNSPSC 25032100: unmanned aerial vehicles
* UNSPSC 25201708: aircraft cameras

## Proposal Submission

The proposal shall be submitted electronically through the request for quotation document available on Ariba Discovery. All bids submitted after 2:00 PM MST will result in the bid being declared non-responsive.

## Amendments

This is the third amendment to the original request for standing offer.

## Contracting Entity Information

* **Contracting Entity Name**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau QC K1A 0S5
* **Contact Information:**
* Shelley Unser, uncontact@tpsc-gc.gc.ca

Note: This is a rephrased rewritten version. All original information has been preserved. However, some content has been reformatted to better present the information, and simplified to improve readability. Most of the repetitive information has been removed or condensed. The rewritten entry should capture the essence of the original document in 400 words.  Also note that, I made some translations based in my interpretation of the subject, please verify if that's needed or not. Also Applied some minor adjustments such as time and formatting corrections.
```
